deck: Christine Everhart is a reporter for the Daily Bugle.
description:
Other Media

Film

Portrayed by actress Leslie Bibb

Iron Man

She appears as a reporter for Vanity Fair Magazine interviewing Tony Stark. She ends up sleeping with him that very night, but is tossed out by Pepper Potts the morning after. Later, she appears again, to tell Stark of the Ten Rings in Gulmira and at the end, suspecting Stark of being Iron Man.

Iron Man 2

Christine accompanies Justin Hammer in Monaco trying to interview him for Vanity Fair, and at the same time trying to make Stark jealous. Stark doesn't seem to care about her and, along with Pepper, humiliates her and Hammer. She loses interest in Hammer when Stark tells her that he has lost the contract with the government.
name: Christine Everhart

deck: orator of Borsia
name: Senator Coyne

deck: A Dinosaur like monster
name: Devil God

deck: enemy of Dynamic Man
name: Professor Monte

name: Libra

deck: Devlunn is a young boy from the 14th Century who fell under the thrall of the Resurrection Stone and used it to animate corpses of victims of the black plague to set himself up as ruler of his village.
name: Devlunn

deck: A Skrull who sought the Resurrection Stone.
name: Jaddak

deck: Holocaust survivor who acquired the Resurrection Stone and used it to reanimate his family's lifeless bodies.
name: Sol Rosenblatt

deck: Wizard who created the Resurrection Stone.
name: Tus'au

deck: A powerful mutant capable of summoning monsters from another dimension.
description:
History

Blake Schiel was the child of abusive parents in Phoenix, Arizona. Her childhood experiences led her to become a very violent, angry person. As she grew up, her violent tendencies developed into criminal activity. She was arrested and convicted after attempting armed robbery of a bank, but broke out of prison when she discovered her mutant ability to conjure monster-like animals from other dimensions. Angry at the whole world, she dubbed herself Animax and unleashed her beasts on innocent people until she was stopped by the X-Men.

In Other Media

Games

X-men: Battle of the Atom

Animax is featured in the mobile card game "X-Men: Battle of the Atom" based on the comic book story with the same name. Her cards are:

  • Animax
name: Animax

deck: Tony Chu's younger cipropanthropatic sister, who has the power to see the past of anyone nearby who eats the same thing she's eating.

issue_credits.name: Family Recipes, Part 1 of 5; Space Cakes, Part 4 1/2 of 5

name: Sage Chu

deck: Purchaser on the slave girl market.
description:
Origin

A frequenter of the slave market in Manoch.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Pays fifty talents for a Circasian slave girl.
name: Zadig

deck: Leader of a band of desert outlaws.
description:
Origin

A confederate of Phao, Tal Azmut seeks to find and destroy Malu so as to take power for his own.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Upon hearing that Faliz and Ganu have captured Malu, Tal Azmut rushes to see the beauty for himself. He finds that Garth has rescued Malu and he orders his bandits to kill Garth and retake Malu. The bandits fail. Tal Azmut is the only person able to escape. He approaches Phao at Ozmut, but Phao is angry that Tal Azmut has failed in preventing Malu's return. He lashes out at Tal Azmut and promises to deal with him later.
name: Tal Azmut

deck: A man loyal to Phao.
description:
Origin

A man who takes orders from Phao.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Ramiz is ordered to take a company of men to meet Malu and Garth outside of city limits. Ramiz does so and, per his orders, takes Garth prisoner and sends Malu to Manoch to be sold as a slave again.
name: Ramiz

deck: Brother of the King of Ormuz and heir to the thrown, if he can get rid of Malu.
description:
Origin

Scheming to take his brother's throne, Phao gets rid of the only child by selling her, Malu, into slavery.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Realizing too late that he cannot take the throne without a signet possessed by Malu, Phao hires Tal Azmut and his bandits to look for Malu and take the ring. Phao hears after some years that Malu is returning home and Tal Azmut's men have failed. (They all die at the hands of Malu's guardian, Garth.) Phao sends out a troop to waylay Malu and Garth. Malu is sold into slavery and Garth is taken captive. Phao gets the ring.

Garth manages to escape and save Malu and he presents her to her father the King of Ormuz. Phao, however, demands proof, knowing full well that he has the proof in his possession. When Garth tries to convince the king that Malu really is his daughter, Phao produces a man who swears that Malu had been his slave for many years prior. Phao is granted the privilege of deserting Malu in the sea while retaining Garth as a slave on Phao's ship.

Aboard the ship, Phao elects to keep Malu as his personal slave while Garth gets shackled to the oars. When pirates attack the ship, Phao has to deal with the pirates and a freed bunch of slaves. He ends up facing Garth, who demands the royal signet be returned to Malu. Phao flees and climbs the mast of his ship. Garth follows. Phao begs for his life and promises to return the signet. Garth grabs the ring and Phao decides to jump from the mast while trying to take Garth down with him. The plan fails and Phao falls solo to his death.
name: Phao

deck: An adventurer who incurs the wraith of an ancient curse.
description:
Origin

Henry and his companions successfully boost some cursed treasure.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Henry's boat breaks down and he and his companions live for some days on the ocean before their leader Altair, breaks down and starts shooting everyone. Henry is the last standing and puts up a valiant effort against Altair but is ultimately killed.
name: Henry

deck: Bandit in the employ of Tal Azmut.
description:
Origin

Desert bandit in the employ of Tal Azmut.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

As Ganu and Faliz wait outside a caravan they see Malu and, knowing of her royal heritage, kidnap her for their leader, Tal Azmut. At their secret hideout, Faliz stays with the prisoner while Ganu heads out to inform Tal Azmut of the capture. Ganu returns to find Faliz dead and Malu escaped. She and her rescuer Garth are soon found and Tal Azmut orders Ganu and the other bandits to kill Garth. They fail. Garth kills all the bandits except for Tal Azmut himself.
name: Ganu

deck: A bandit of Tal Azmut.
description:
Origin

Desert bandit in the employ of Tal Azmut.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

As Faliz and Ganu wait outside a caravan they see Malu and, knowing of her royal heritage, kidnaps her for their leader, Tal Azmut. At their secret hideout, Faliz stays with the prisoner while Ganu heads out to inform Tal Azmut of the capture. Garth soon arrives to find Malu and immediately cuts down Faliz, as he was the lone guard.
name: Faliz

deck: An adventurer who incurs the wraith of an ancient curse.
description:
Origin

Led a group of adventurers into an old, sacred place and recovered some cursed treasure.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Having procured the treasure, Altair leads his men on a boat to return home across the ocean. The boat has mechanical issues, however, and the men are left adrift at sea. Altair slowly loses his mind and, in desperation, kills his crew. Henry is the last man standing and attempts to kill Altair with the boat's rudder. Altair shoots him first and is left alone with his treasure. He begins to think the treasure actually is cursed until another boat is seen. The boat doesn't see him, however, and Altair is run over and killed.
name: Altair

deck: Tyrant and usurper.
description:
Origin

Thuz takes the rule away from a boy king and reign in terror.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

While on his throne, Thuz is shown Garth and Malu. He immediately lusts for Malu and orders that the two be given aid to recover from their travels. He then plots with his right hand man, Mordo, to dispense with Garth and keep Malu for himself. The men retire to a room in which Thuz can hear what is being said throughout the palace. He hears a servant girl, Selda, inform the "guests" of Thuz's plans and the two try to escape. Thuz cuts them off and orders them to attend a banquet in their honor.

At the banquet, Thuz tries to poison Garth. Darmo, another servant, warns Malu about the poison. Malu then attempts to get Thuz to drink from the tainted cup. Seeing that his plan has gone amiss, Thuz orders his guards to kill Garth while he tries to physically remove Malu from the room. Garth cuts his way to Malu and then cuts Thuz down.
name: Thuz

deck: Old man who has charge of Tarkan prisoners.
description:
Origin

A feeble guard.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

The warden is given charge of watching over the warrior and suspected spy, Garth. He is approached by Malu, who bribes him to let her enter the cell to speak secretly with Garth. The warden reluctantly agrees and waits impatiently as the two plot. Malu's exit is too late, however, and the warden's folly is discovered by palace guards. They kill him immediately for his insubordination.
name: Warden

deck: Father of Malu, the mistaken slave girl.
description:
Origin

King of the city of Ormuz. His daughter, Malu, went missing years prior and with went the signet of Ormuz, a powerful ring granting powers to the possessor.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

The king is amazed to see one day the supposed return of his daughter. His brother, Phao, however, claims the girl is a fake. It actually is Malu and she claims Phao is conspiring against the king to take the thrown and her only proof was possession of the ring, which Phao now holds. The king doesn't know who to believe and calls for the guards to help settle the mess. In the end, Phao produces a man who swears that Malu had been his slave for many years prior. The king believes Phao and orders Malu to deserted at sea and Garth to become Phao's slave.
name: King of Ormuz

deck: Keeper of the whip in Tarko.
description:
Origin

Resident whipper in the kingdom of Tarko.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Marco gets ready to whip Garth, a new prisoner, but gets usurped by the King of Tarko. The king is upset with Garth and takes the pleasure of inflicting pain unto himself. Marco simply watches.
name: Marco

deck: Tyrant king of the Tarkanians.
description:
Origin

Leader of the Tarkanians with a harem of slave girls.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

While in his chambers, the king is presented with a fresh prisoner. The king demands to know of the prisoner's mission and, when no answer is given, proceeds to whip the man. The prisoner remains quiet. The king is about to whip the man again but is halted when Malu, one of his slave girls, spills a tray of water on his robes. In a fury, he sends the man away and turns his anger onto Malu.

Despite his treatment of Malu, she visits the prisoner anyway. When the king hears of this traitorous activity he sentences both she and the prisoner, Garth, to death by lions. The king mocks the two of them as they await their fate in the pit. He isn't aware, however, that someone has let slip the secret exit from the pit. Malu finds it and the lions are released into the city. The king watches in horror as he is ripped apart.
name: King of Tarko

deck: Slave girl for the usurper Thuz.
description:
Origin

Made a slave to serve the usurping king Thuz.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

When Malu and Garth are shown to a room in Thuz's palace, Selda informs them that Thuz plans on killing Garth and keeping Malu as his newest prize. Based on this information, Malu and Garth try to escape. Thuz hears of Selda's disloyalty and orders her to be tortured. It is unknown if she is freed once the boy king is given his thrown back.
name: Selda

deck: Right-hand man to the usurping king Thuz.
description:
Origin

A confidante of Thuz, Mordo is asked to be the royal counselor.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

When Malu and Garth arrive in Mordo's city, they are brought before the king. The king instantly desires Malu and sends Mordo to make plans to dispose of Garth. Before Mordo can do so, however, Malu and Garth are warned as to the king's intentions by Selda, another slave girl. Mordo heads off the two escapees.

The king takes things into his own hands in order to dispose of Garth by having Mordo prepare a banquet in the "guests'" honor. Mordo does so and has wine prepared with poison for Garth. Malu is once again warned by a slave girl, Darmo, and she thwarts the attempt to poison Garth. The king calls for his soldiers to kill Garth and Mordo has to scramble to avoid the fight. The slaves clash, as well, and it is unknown if Mordo survives the fight and flees or is killed.
name: Mordo

deck: Archeologist and believer in mystic arts.
description:
Origin

An archeologist, Geoffry Garth explores many lands. His main focus is finding the lost signet of Ormuz.

Note: The first comic foreshadows that Geoffry and Sandra Worth may know each other from a former time. The allusion is that they are in fact linked as being both themselves and somehow Garth and Malu the slave girl, whose stories they witness through magic. The comic did not last long enough for this to be answered. As such, Garth and Geoffry are treated as separate people for the sake of clarity in the wiki.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

After yet again failing to find the royal signet of Ormuz, Geoffry returns to home to regroup. He attends a party hosted by Sandra Worth, a beautiful redhead. They meet and he is astonished to discover that she possesses a ring that would appear to be the exact duplicate - if not the real thing - of the ring he has been searching for. The two find a corner to talk and he explains that the ring, if legitimate, should enable the possessor to view the past.

The next night, Sandra enters Geoffry's office and they attempt to use the ring. He reads from an old parchment and the two are overcome by visions of the past. They view a slave girl (Malu) being rescued by a soldier (Garth) and adventures the two have together. The ring eventually loses its power and Geoffry and Sandra agree to try the ring's powers again the following night.

The ring works the next night and Geoffry and Sandra see further adventures of Garth and Malu.
name: Geoffry Garth

deck: Slave girl for the usurping king Thuz.
description:
Origin

Made a slave to serve the usurping king Thuz.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

Thuz has a plan to poison his guest Garth so as to take Malu as his own. He instructs Darmo to serve a goblet of wine to Garth that has been prepared with poison. Darmo informs Malu of this trick. When Malu tries a trick of her own, Thuz knows the ruse is over and orders his troops to kill Garth. The slaves revolt and take back the kingdom but Darmo's fate is unknown.
name: Darmo

deck: Young king of a distant land.
description:
Origin

Successive heir to the crown in his city. He is overthrown by Thuz.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

The government of Thuz is overthrown when two visitors, Malu and Garth, visit and incite the slaves to bring the boy king back to power. As a sign of gratitude, the king allows the two to travel with his caravan for protection, as well as giving them food, clothes, and other necessary provisions for their travels.
name: Boy King

deck: A rich and beautiful socialite.
description:
Origin

Rich and beautiful woman who throws lovely parties.

Note: The first comic foreshadows that Geoffry and Sandra Worth may know each other from a former time. The allusion is that they are in fact linked as being both themselves and somehow Garth and Malu the slave girl, whose stories they witness through magic. The comic did not last long enough for this to be answered. As such, Garth and Geoffry are treated as separate people for the sake of clarity in the wiki.

Creation

Drawn by Howard Larsen.

Major Story Arcs

During one of her parties, Sandra is introduced to an archeologist named Geoffry Garth. The two feel they have met before but brush it off. As they talk, Geoffry notices Sandra's ring. She explains it as an old heirloom and is surprised to find that Geoffry has been looking for that exact ring, or at least its original. Sandra learns that her ring has the appearance of the signet of Ormuz. The two find a corner to talk and he explains that the ring, if legitimate, should enable the possessor to view the past.

The next night, Sandra enters Geoffry's office and they attempt to use the ring. She sits and waits as he reads from an old parchment and the two are overcome by visions of the past. They view a slave girl (Malu) being rescued by a soldier (Garth) and adventures the two have together. The ring eventually loses its power and Geoffry and Sandra agree to try the ring's powers again the following night.

The ring works the following night and she and Geoffry see the further adventures of Malu and Garth.
name: Sandra Worth

deck: Creator of the Vital Serum which gives the user a skull face and super strength.
name: Doctor Storm

deck: German Ally of the original Destroyer AKA Flora von Bangor

issue_credits.name: The Terror Of The Slimy Japs!
The Case Of The Black Dragon Society

name: Florence von Banger

deck: Nazi Mad Scientist
name: The Scar

deck: Nazi scientist and Creator of the Formula that empowered the original Destroyer.
name: Professor Eric Schmitt

description:
History

Lawrence Shrott was a famous 1940s boxer called the Ape, known for both his savage in-ring dominance and his ape-like appearance. His fame attracted the attention of two individuals in particular: a crime boss named Big Joe and Bill Waring (secret identity of Challenger.) Big Joe wanted to employ The Ape for his muscle and Bill feared just such a thing. One night after a match, Big Joe`s men approached the Ape in his dressing room with an offer if he helped them with a bank heist and the Ape agreed.

Although the bank heist is successful, Big Joe and the rest of his men betray the Ape by leaving him behind. During The Ape`s own attempted escape, a bullet struck him in the head. While the Ape survived the gunshot, the bullet became lodged in his skull sending him into a psychotic rage. He was then determined to get revenge on Big Joe for abandoning him, so he returned to Big Joe`s hideout with the intent to kill. It just so happened that he wasn`t alone though, as the Challenger had followed him back there from the scene of the bank heist. The Challenger was too late to prevent the Ape from killing Big Joe and The Ape managed to get away from him.

Still filled with a murderous rage, the Ape ended up killing a shop keeper in order to obtain some food. The Challenger followed the Ape`s trail of destruction and the two men began their fight once more. The Ape was ultimately defeated when the Challenger struck the exact point on his skull where the bullet had been lodged. The Ape seemingly died from his injuries.

Powers & Abilities

The Ape possessed an unknown degree of superhuman strength. The Ape was also skilled in unarmed combat having been a trained boxer.
name: The Ape

description:
History

Doctor Weems was a brilliant doctor whose main goal was finding a cure for Pneumonia. Believing that he had come upon a cure he decided to test it on himself even though he didn't have pneumonia because he believed it safer. The chemical had an unforeseen effect on Weems, he was transformed in a Jekyll and Hyde-like manner, turning him into a being who craved nothing more than money and power. Weems' new persona gathered together a group of criminals to form his own gang, earning the name, The Grinner, because of his large and insane grin. With his gang, the Grinner started an unstoppable crime spree of stolen goods and murder.

Eventually, the Grinner targeted Mr. Dillon, the owner of an extremely profitable oil property in Texas. The Grinner brought his men in to try and extort the property from Mr. Dillon which brought them into conflict with Black Marvel. The Grinner fled and returned home in order to take another dose of his formula to transform back into Weems. When Black Marvel arrived the rouse seemed to work and he left confused as to where the Grinner may have gone. This momentary distraction allowed the Grinner's men to capture Mr. Dillon.

When the Grinner had his men leave a ransom note for Dillon's wife, the Black Marvel was there to follow them back to their hideout. The Grinner was unable to defeat Black Marvel in combat and instead chose to flee back to Weems' home. The Black Marvel once again caught him returning to the Weems residence and caught him mid-transformation. In the ensuing struggle, Black Marvel struck the Grinner who went reeling backward striking his head in a death blow. As he died, the Grinner transformed back into Weems and reading Weems' notes, Black Marvel solved the mystery of the Grinner.

Powers & Abilities

Dr. Weems had no superhuman abilities was a brilliant medical doctor. While the Grinner had no documented superhuman powers, the formula that transformed him seemed to increase his muscle mass and change his bone structure.
name: The Grinner

deck: Diamondback's brother who was killed by Crossbones.
name: Ricky Leighton

volume_credits.name: Captain America: Scourge of the Underworld

deck: A selfish party girl.
description:
A friend of Aya and Adjoua. She had her eyes on Moussa and wanted to marry him (out of money).

But then Adjoya did that. She was pissed.

Eventually, she cooled down, and became the second one of Adjoyas kids aunts.
name: Bintou

deck: One of the Protagonists of the comics-series named after her.
description: Aya aims to become a doctor. She`s smart, and often has to deal with her difficult friends and family.
name: Aya

deck: A lousy rich guy.
description:
He`s the unloving (and on few occasions, even violent) father of Moussa (though he gives him money to spend) and the president of the Solibra beer company.

He made Moussa and Adjoua marry eachother, when Moussa supposedly impregnated Adjoua.
name: Mr. Sissoko

deck: A young man who doesn`t do alot of useful things.
description:
Rich kid who likes chics. He`s interested in Bintou, but due to her not showing any interest in im, he goes to Adjoua instead.

They later get married, because Moussa has supposedly impregnated Adjoua, and they are forced to marry eachother.

Moussa doesn`t mind, because things don`t really change to worse.
name: Moussa

deck: Adjouas mother.
name: Hyacinthe

description:
A friend of Aya and Bintou who loves to party. She`s impregnated later, by Moussa.

Because Moussas parents want it, she marries him. And because Moussas family is rich she doesn`t mind.

Later, when the child is born, it`s found out that the father is actually Mamadou.
name: Adjoua

deck: She is the Joker's Aunt.
name: Aunt Eunice

volume_credits.name: DC Comics The New 52 Villains Omnibus

deck: In IDW's continuity, Skar was the sixth Dynobot and acted as field medic
description: Skar theorized in Dynamic Alt-Mode Adaptation. He believed that the Transformers could change their alt-mode at will and adapt to their situation. His theory was proven when the Dinobots were on their final mission. In order to combat a primal force the Dynobots adapted by creating more primal alt-modes. Unfortunately Skar did not survive the encounter.
name: Skar
